page.title: 06Worksop College Buildings
page.content: There have been three chapels at the college,with the first two being temporary buildings.The final one was built in 1911 with many splendid designs including Kemp stained glass windows.The most recent addition to the buildings is the Churchill Hall, constructed in 1975. The college used to contain a prep school for children under the age of thirteen but another Woodard establishment was opened at Rauby,so five years later the school was moved from Worksop to Rauby.Now about fifty percent of the Worksop College intake have been to Rauby. At present there are sixty girls at the College and two hundred and eighty boys at the college.Pupils mainly come from the South Yorkshire and Nottinghamshire area.
